intro: Caulinia monophylla var. trifoliolata, commonly known as the three-leaf caulinia, is a rare variant of the caulinia plant characterized by its unique trifoliate leaves. This plant belongs to the family Malvaceae and is native to specific regions in Africa. It features elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are clustered in groups of three, giving it its distinguishing appearance. The flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered in dense inflorescences, typical of the genus. It is often found in moist, shaded environments and is valued for its ornamental qualities in botanical gardens.
